resources.string: \ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.

• Selecting Characters 
 Click on the game console icon to begin the game. A user will be given 3 minutes (180 seconds) to identify words in the grid. The character selection is by simply touching the tile in which the character is placed. 


• Valid word check 
 As the user selects characters they will appear in red below the grid. Once a valid word is selected the colour of the text wil automatically change to green. 


• Scoring 
 Scoring is based on the length of the word identified. Longer the word, higher the points. Each character has the same weightage and hence the score is entirely based on the length. 


• Game controls 
 The user will be able to see 4 game control buttons at the bottom. They are Pause, Hints and Stop button from left to right. If a user clicks on Pause button, the grid will become inactive and the timer stops. Also the Pause button is replaced by The game can be resumed by clicking on the Resume button. The Hints button, should the user choose to avail this option, will prompt the users with word hints during game play. The Stop button stops the game play. 


• Game End 
 At the end of the game, the user is shown his/her score and the words selected.
